"Hello there."
The thirteen year old Naruto looked around, seeing no one but himself was any where in the area, he turned back and tilted his head in confusion at the pretty girl before him. She was an inch or so taller than him, long white hair reaching down her back, and beautiful purple eyes that gazed back at him happily. She was pretty. She appeared nice. And she was willingly talking to the outcast of konoha. The light eighty-five pound genin didn't know what to think. Naruto immediately knew something was wrong, but non the less, smiled at her in return.
"Hello?" He answered, quite unsure of himself. No girl willingly talked to him, not with his hidious whisker like scars across his face and bad reputation, especially when Uchiha Sasuke was inthe facility. Sasuke wasn't any where to be seen though and she was talking to him. She gave him a huge smile, a blush lightly covering her cheeks, and seemed to be trying to get up the courage to say something.
"I... I think your cute!" She cried out suddenly. Naruto nearly had a heart attack, alarm bells going off, as he stared at her in utter shock. She hurried on quickly to explain herself. "I moved here a few months ago and you pass by my family's shop every day... and I've been wanting to ask you out on a date! So... will you go out with me tonight?" She asked loudly. Naruto blushed horribly, nodding his head, though still weary.
"Um.. but... Whats your name?" Naruto asked curiously.
"Oh, how stupid of me! I'm Sana." The girl introduced herself hurriedly.
"It's nice to meet you Sana, my name is..." Naruto started, despite his caution he was excited to meet someone who apparently liked him right off the bat. It was refreshing and nice. "...Naruto Uzumaki the greatest prankster and savior from the scary Sand nin Gaara!" Sana finished excitedly. "I've heard a whole bunch of stories about you Uzumaki-san!" Sana said with a squeal of excitement. Naruto blushed horribly, pleasantly surprised that it was a negative story she'd heard about him, and smiled warmly at her.
"Just call me Naruto and I woudn't say saviour exactly." Naruto said with a laugh.
"Alright Naruto, why don't you come to my grandmothers restaurant tonight, called the Lamplighter?" She asked.
"I'll be there!" Naruto told her, happiness bubbling over, he'd never been asked to hang out with anyone before after all.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------
Naruto entered the restaurant temptatively, but relaxed when the elderly women smiled at him, rather than toss him out immediately. Perhaps people's minds about him were finally changing, Naruto could only hope that was the truth, before scanning the rather large restaurant. Sana waved at him fromt the back of the restaurant, smiling broadly, dressed in a beautiful long sleeved black dress. Naruto himself had simply chosen to leave his weapons, ninja headband, and orange jacket behind. His orange pants along with his simple black net shirt was something that Sakura had once said was 'presentable.' Naruto excitedly sat down across from the beautiful Sana who was, as Naruto gaged her to be, maybe a year older than himself. He didn't understand how someone so beautiful could actually want to go out with someone like him, but he wasn't going to argue.
"Guess what Naruto?!" She asked, eyes bright with mischief.
"What?" Naruto asked.
"My grandmother is having some huge political members and their families of Fire country's capital eat here and she needs a couple people to try out some of her new plates and deserts and I got her to let us do it!" Sana said with a flourish of her arms. Naruto grinned back at her. "Thats really cool!" Naruto admitted. He'd never done anything like this before. None of his friends ever invited him over to their families place and none of them had ever wanted to hang out with him and on top of that she actually was offering all the food he could eat to help out her family? How utterly fricking cool. A kind elderly man, who Sana introduced as her grandfather, brought out a couple of drinks. "Tastetesters," the old man said, "of some new drinks to offer on the menu." Naruto grinned and took a huge sip as the man watched, not wanting to do it half heartedly for fear of insulting the man, and nodded happily at the great taste. "I think you have a keeper." Naruto told that man honestly. The old man grinned. "I think so too." And suddenly after drinking the odd but good tasting flavor Naruto felt a sudden utter emptiness in his stomach.
For the next two hours Sana's grandparents brought out deserts after deserts and trays of appetizers and platters of food, all of which Naruto would try and tell them what he thought of it, he was having so much fun that he didn't notice that Sana barely tried any of the foods. He didn't notice that he ate more than was strickly tolerable of each 'tastetester' or that his stomach started to hurt after the first forty-five minutes. This was due to the fact that no matter how many bites he took the empty feeling in his stomach that came with the drink wouldn't go away. He finally noticed how much he'd gorged on when he felt a strange tightness and looked down. His net shirt, which had been slightly loose at the beginning of the meal was stretched tight over his overstuffed stomach, it would be difficult to pull off. Naruto blushed and stopped mid bite, even though his stomach still felt strangely empty, he put the bite of pie back onto his plate. Sana was looking at him with a smile on her face. "Whats wrong Naruto?" She asked lightly. Naruto shrugged, the motion forcing his overstuffed stomach to move up, causing him to wince in pain.
"I ate waaaaay too much," Naruto said with a laugh, "thank you so much for tonight Sana. I've never had so much fun and all the food was great. Your grandparents are awsome cooks." Naruto looked at the clock on the wall, it was already pretty late, the long hand nearly at ten. "I think I'm gonna head home now though, I'll see you tommorow in front of your shop okay? Then I can treat you to ramen at this cool place I know?" Naruto asked, trying to keep the hope out of his voice, he really liked talking to her. She smiled and stood up, standing behind him and hugging him, her hand wandering down to his stomach and keeping it there for some strange reason. Naruto turned his head a bit to look at her, idly wondering if she thought he was fat after his strange gorging session, after all he didn't normally eat nearly that much.
"Can I ask you something Naruto?"
"Sure, what is it?"
"How would you get rid of a person for a certan period of timethat could pose a problem for your plans?"
"Sorry... what?"
"By forcing them to gain enough weight as to be useless until they lose it."
A cloth covered in a strong odor suddenly flew over his mouth. Naruto tried to stand but the moment he attempted to he felt unbalaced and lost conciousness.

As a jinchuuriki, albit a thirteen year old, Naruto's chakra was large enough that the mere residue of his chakra nullified hidden enemy chakra around the villages city district. This fact was a secret known only to the anbu, Naruto and Hokage herself though, so the fact that this women knew about Naruto's ability was terrifying.

"Where is Naruto?!" Tsunade hissed out through clenched teeth. The women laughed wetly, turning her head and spitting blood from between cracked lips. "In quite a bit of pain actually, the poor dear didn't enjoy his time with me at all, I had a lot of fun though." She said lightly, grinning impishly up at the infuriated women. "About three days ago Naruto-kun was even begging me to kill him. He couldn't take the pain anymore." The women said from her position on the floor. A foot slammed down harshly on the white haired womens throat the moment those words escaped.

"Tsunade! If you kill her we may never find him!" Ibiki called, pulling the blonde women away. Tsunade brushed her hair out of her face, eyes glaring with hatred at the gasping women on the floor. "I'll... I'll tell you where... he is... if you... cough... if you talk to me alone without... anbu." The women said through a bloody grin. Ibiki shook his head at his Hokage. "Give me a few hours and I'll have her begging for mercy." Ibiki whispered. Apparently not quietly enough though.

"Except there's a memory seal on my body. Whether I have chakra or not I can activate it, and all of my memories will be gone, including Naruto's location." The women stated simply. Tsunade hesitated for only a moment before silently raising her arm. The anbu instantly dissapeared. Ibiki hesitated, giving his Hokage a stern glare, before the women spoke again. "Bring one person you trust with Naruto-kuns life. Our deal will need two people." The women whispered. Tsunade considered it and nodded.

"Ibiki, bring me Kakashi, and tell him to make it quick." Tsunade said loudly. Ibiki too faded out to obey.
_____________________________________________

When Kakashi entered the room he had to restrain himself from butchering the women. Ten days ago. Ten long days Naruto had been missing and to be mere feet from the women who caused and not be able to do anything was unbelievably frustrating. At some point Tsunade had yanked the women's chair back up and into position, the women herself in the center of the room, directly in front of the criminal. "He's here." Tsunade snapped. "So what is this deal?" The women smiled softly.

"Simple really. Freedom for freedom. You two will wear microphones around your neck; one of you will go with me to the edge of the fire nation border while the other will be directed to Naruto's location. There are four seal doors to an underground chamber to get to Naruto while there are five chakra chains on me. The closer I get to the border the closer you get to Naruto. We will sign it in blood so that if one foresakes the other in this deal the three of us, and by extention four of us, will die. I don't know about the rest of you, but I certainly want to live. Is this acceptable?" The white haired women asked. Kakashi met Tsunade's eyes and nodded.

"Tell me something first. How do we know that Naruto isn't dead?" Kakashi asked, eyes cold. The women smirked at him. "I was part of a smaller division of Konoha anbu so we both know Naruto isn't dead. The reason I didn't consider it and the reason I tortured him the way i did was in order to keep the fox from reacting. As long as Naruto's LIFE isn't in danger, meaning wounded or dying, then the fox refuses to help Naruto. An interesting and dire weakness for a Jinchuuriki who has a creative enemy. Naruto is alive and I will tell you exactly what I've done to him, but first you must sign to secure my life. Afterward you hear what I've done you probably will be far less willing to make this deal." The white haired women said softly. Both Tsunade and Kakashi's eyes narrowed at the women, fingers twitching to snap her neck at the mere implication of what she might mean, before stilling it with the sombering thought that Naruto's life was in their hands.

Tsunade quickly drew up the blood contract in a matter of minutes, allowing the lowly criminal to inspect it to her hearts desire, before the three of them signed it. The criminals hands, that were now untied due to the need to sign in her own blood and signature, lay in her lap in a peaceful way that drove both Tsunade and Kakashi to clench their own hands. "I would like you to look at it from my point of view." The white haired women began. "I could not kill him nor wound him for fear of Kyuubi reacting and alerting you. I am incapable of using genjutsu or mind jutsus so harming his mentality was strictly impossible. So how do you cause a person a great deal of horrible pain without wounding them physically or emotionally? It was quite a dilemma for some time. What pain could I inflict on him horrible enough to make it impossible to move or escape without the option of actually threatening their life? I'll admit that my technique brought Naruto close to death nearly every night..." At this Kakashi growled angrily, wanting to throttle the women, and beside him Tsunade was in just as bad shape. "However, I found a way to do it without alarming the fox. You see the fox is a being made out of chakra whose only concern over his body is physical wounds. He doens't need food or water to keep him alive and thus doens't understand nor care about the suject enough to interfere in any way with his Jinchuuriki in this area." The women said triumphantly. Kakashi really didn't understand where the women was getting with all of this, but Tsunade seemed to have a light of understanding, there was still confusion there though.

"So the fox doesn't understand the concept of starvation," Tsunade said quietly, her face paling. The womens laughter was as loud as thunder in Kakashi's ears. Still, he coudlnt' help but feel a tiny drop of relief. He'd read the thirds description of Naruto's childhood and knew Naruto was very much used to starvation. It was still a horrible thing that infuriated him and he would no doubt crush anyone in his way to save his student, but he knew Naruto could recover from something like this. The smile though, the smile on the women's face seemed to be laughing at them.

"Tsunade, what type of body would you say Naruto has?" The criminal asked.

"Small, he's the smallest of all our genin." Tsunade answered wearily. The smile grew.

"Tell me, what fun would starving an already obviosu starved child be?" The criminal asked, grin widening. And then Kakashi's leader did something that he never thought she'd do in front of the enemy. She vomited... a lot. Tsunade's legs gave out beneath her and Kakashi swiftly caught the women before all her dignity was out the window. Her hands were shaking horribly. Kakashi was terrified now. What had the women done to Naruto that would send a Kage into such a state at the mere thought?

"You..." Tsuande whispered, completely horrified, "You force fed him?" The criminals smile became positively insane. Kakashi choked back on his own bile. His little Naruto had been force fed? To near death? It was one of the worst tortures imaginable. To have your body feel as if it was tearing itself out from the inside and to have food still being shoved down your throat was a torture rarely used because of the sheer inhumanity of it.

"It was so much fun to watch him kick and fight against me, to see him scream and sob and then beg for death, and to still keep on going. What an entertaining person to fatten up. It really woudlnt' have been nearly as entertaining if the kid hadn't been practically starving." The criminal said with a laugh. Tsunade nearly attacked the woman, but Kakashi managed to just keep the deadly fist out of reach. Barely. He felt incredibly sick himself. Tsunade turned her head away, visibly trying to collect herself before nodding to Kakashi to show that she was alright.

"How... how much did you... force him to gain?" Tsunade asked quietly, her medical part of her brain insisting she needed to know. The woman giggle and suddenly Kakashi found himself not wanting to know. She held up her hand and spread out her fingers so that all ten of them were showing.

"I had ten days with the boy Tsunade, and I drove him to near death every... single... night, he packed on a lot." She said through fits of giggles. Kakashi coudlnt' hear any more, he walked to the corner and vomited, before slowly wiping his mouth. 'Oh god, Naruto!' Kakashi thought in horror.

"How much?" Tsunade gritted out. Tears were fighting to pour from her eyes as she mentally went through the horror his body had endured through this ten day force feeding. Naruto's body was small and to add weight like she was suggesting she'd done meant Naruto's body was badly damaged by it. Depending on how much she'd forced him to eat and how much weight he'd gained from it Naruto woudln't be able to walk until the damage was fixed. The women laughed hysterically, filling the chamber with her loud, insane noise.

"I forced Naruto to gain sixty-six pounds," The white haired woman yelled. Kakashi vomited again. Tsunade fell to her knees in shocked horror. The damage would be tremedous to the boy's body. Naruto simply wasn't meant to have a body that heavy. They would be lucky if Naruto could 'stand' for a while much less 'walk.' Kakashi glared at the women still sitting in the chair with hatred. 'If I ever see you again after this day you will die a slow painful death.' Kakashi vowed.
_____________________________________________

Kakashi followed the instructions he was given through the radio relayed by Tsunade as he moved further underground. It had been twenty five miles from Konoha, but still within the mountains. At the moment he was in one of them, listening in as he made his way through the first three sealed doors, and into a dungeon like area with dozens of locked cells. Kakashi counted down the numbers, as instructed, until he found himself in front of a large door labeled fifteen. "I'm in front of the fourth seal door now and awaiting further instructions." Kakashi relayed over the radio.

Kakashi heard the sound of feet shuffling and murmurs from the other end. "She says that its a combination seal. You must press your hands up to the door, channel chakre through it, and then twist the seal rings in a certain order. Are you ready for me to relay the order?" Tsunade asked quietly. Naruto was behind this door, they were both tense, and filled with deadly hope that Naruto was alright. "Yes." Kakashi replied back calmly. First ring turn left three times... second ring turn left two times... third ring turn right once... fourth ring turn left three times... press your hand firmly into the center circle. It should be open now..." Kakashi opened the prison door wide and stepped inside, the bulb was broken, the cell cast in darkness. "Is he there?" Tsunade's voice asked, obviously tense with fear.

"Naruto?" Kakashi gently called. A figure leaning against the wall on the opposite side shifted and moaned.

"Ka... Kakashi?" Naruto's voice spoke out of the darkness in a hoarse, broken whisper.

"I'm here Naruto." Kakashi said as he rushed over. Naruto began to sob.
111211.title: Kakashi finds Naruto

choices: Sasuke and Sakura are told what happened but don't get to see Naruto till later
Sasuke and Sakura are told what happened and see Naruto immediately
1112111.content:
"Don't touch me! Please... don't touch me!" Naruto's broken voice came out of the darkness.

Kakashi stopped moving toward the blonde, instead stopping several feet in front of him, and crouching down. "It's okay Naruto, it's me Kakashi, I'm here to get save you." Kakashi whispered to the dark corner. A choked sob echoed from the darkness and Kakashi had to force himself to not race over to him immediately. "Please Naruto, let me help you, I'll take you to the hospital." Kakashi said softly, hoping he sounded reassuring. After such horrible torture Kakashi wasn't sure what state of mind Naruto was in.

"Kashi... I... sniffle... I don't think... I can walk." Naruto said hoarsely, obviously trying to suppress a sob.

"It's okay Naruto, I'll carry you." Kakashi said soothingly.

"I... hic.. don't think... you can... carry me... she... I... I'm..." Naruto lost the battle and broke out in a heart renching sob.

Kakashi rushed forward and gently hugged his student to him as the boy sobbed into his chest. When Kakashi's hands felt the fattened body he had to will himself not to vomit. Naruto would take it the wrong way, his student would assume that he was disguested with him instead of what had been 'done' to him. Kakashi felt around Naruto till his hands touched the bloody cuffs of metal painfully binding them to the wall and with a quick and powerful jutsu broke the pieces apart, quickly doing the same to the metal that held Naruto's ankles to the ground, the moment he was release Naruto completely collapsed against Kakashi's chest. The sobbing filled the large dungean area as Kakashi gently wrapped his arms around his students form. Which was slightly difficult with the large amount of weight Naruto had been forced to gain. It mere size Kakashi gouged Naruto to be twice the size he'd been a mere ten days ago.

As his student sobbed Kakashi gently touched each part of his body, checking for wounds and trying to best see in the dark how large his student would look in the light, he did not want Naruto to see a look of stun or horror in his eyes. It would surely break the boy. Naruto's shirt was stretched tight over the large stone like watermelon of a stomach he now sported which dipped over the edge of his pants and stretched a few inches past Kakashi's own waist in width. The hardness was an obvious sign that his stomach had been forcefully stretched out over a short period of time. It would take at least a weak for it to soften at all after what had been done. Kakashi tried desperately not to think of how incredibly painful it had been and still was. Kakashi's fingers lightly traced the boy's sides and down his leg, passing it off as trying to sooth the boy's sobbing, and found the same tightness. Even when Naruto lost the weight he would probably never be rid of the stretch marks. Kakashi silently cringed. Naruto, his little eighty-five pound Naruto, was indeed at the unbelievable weight of a hundred and fifty pounds after being tortured through forced feeding.

"Kashi... everything hurts so much... I just want to die." Naruto whispered. "When I move it feels like my bodies ripping and tearing. It hurts to breath so much... and I'm so fat I can't even stand up. Please just kill me." Naruto begged. Kakashi felt like his heart was being ripped out of his chest. In the darkness of the prison room Kakashi let a few tears leak from his eyes and fall on his tortured students body.

"Please Naruto, don't give up on me yet, I know your in a lot of pain but please just bare with me for a little longer. I'm gonna take you to the hospital and then they'll help you get better." Kakashi begged. Naruto buried his face in Kakashi's lap before letting out a tiny wisp of air that sounded suspiciously like a bitter laugh.

"How are you gonna get me to the hospital when I weigh almost as much as you do?" Naruto whispered painfully.

"I'm a lot stronger than I look Naruto, I promise I'll get you there." Kakashi said.

"You haven't even seen me yet sensei. I'm fatter than Chouji by... a lot." Naruto admitted, voice cracking.

"I'll manage." Kakashi said sternly.

"But..." Naruto's voice burned with shame and pain at this point. "I don't want anyone to see me like this."

"If that's how you want it for right now then only Tsunade and I will see you for right now." Kakashi told his student quietly. Sasuke and Sakura would kill him for making that promise, after they had been searching for their teammate for so long none stop, but it was for the best. Naruto desperately needed to recover some before he saw anyone. Ten days was a long time to be trapped in a nightmare. Kakashi stood up and helped Naruto unsteadily to his feet, the blonde stood on shaky legs, body swaying from side to side. He just needed to get Naruto out of the cell and then he would carry his student all the way to Konoha after that.

When they reached the lightened hallway Kakashi unconciously glance down at his student. Naruto's large body was larger than he'd first invisioned. Naruto heavily leaned against his teachers body, walking with the large addition of weight for the first time, and blushing horribly in shame. The poor boy tried desperately to pull the too small shirt he was wearing over the rather huge stomach that was bulging out in full view with the belly button looking depressedly at the floor. Now that they were out in the light Kakashi could see that Naruto's face was burning up with fever, yet another effect of the obvious strain on his body, and his chest was moving up and down with difficulty. Naruto refused to look at him and Kakashi supposed that if the situation was switched he would feel shameful as well, even if the entire event was not his fault in the least, unreasonable but human nature. Kakashi crouched down and motioned with his hands for Naruto to get on his back. Naruto blushed horribly and shook his head.

"I'm too fat Kashi sensei." Naruto whispered.

"Get on Naruto, I need to get you to a hospital now, we don't have time to argue. Please?" Kakashi said reasonably.

Naruto wrapped his arms around his senseis neck, but cried out in pain as his bloated, stone like stomach smashed against Kakashi's back. Kakashi tensed as he heard the cry and felt Naruto's body nearly fall to the ground behind him. Kakashi spun and caught Naruto's form instantly, worried eyes watching as tears silently leaked from Naruto's eyes as the blonde held onto his stomach. Kneeling on the ground until the tip of his nose touched stone.

"'M sorry, just give me a minute, I'll be okay." Naruto whispered, his eyes tightly closed as his entire body twinge in pain. Kakashi bent down beside him and rubbed the boy's back in circular motions.

"Take as long as you need." Kakashi instructed.

"'M sorry, I'm ready." Naruto whispered as he forced himself off the ground and to stand unstabilly. Kakashi automatically reached out and stedied him, garnering a tired, pain filled smile from naruto as Thanks. Once more Naruto wrapped his arms around Kakashi, forcing himself to ignore the pain that erupted from his stomach as he did so, and squeezed his eyes shut. Naruto blushed as Kakashi gave a grunt of effort before finally lifting Naruto's body off the ground, barely holding on to the fattened legs that attempted to make its way around the blondes gut and Kakashi's waist, and unsteadily taking off toward Konoha. When they reached the gates Kakashi placed an anbu level genjutsu cloak around the both of them and slipped throught the gates toward the hospital.

11121111.content:
Kakashi closed the door behind him and tiredly sank to the floor. He'd managed to accomplish the trip without his student seeing how difficult and painful it was for the man. Carrying an obese Naruto for twenty five miles strait had been hell, but he refused to let it show in any way. It had been blatently obvious how absolutely ashamed the boy had been about his weight even if it had been induced through forced feeding. Kakashi had refused to allow any show of emotion to slip out so that Naruto wouldn't feel worse about the situation.

Tsunade, who ordered an anbu team after the bitch that had imprisoned and tortured Naruto, escaped over the border, ran down the hospital hallway with a look of terror on her face. "How is he?" She whispered. Kakashi shook his head sadly.

"He's in a horrible amount of pain and doesn't want any one to see him outside of you and me. Everything she said about what she did to him is true. Parts of his skin are raw red from being stretched so badly and his whole body's tight. He really is a hundred and fifty, maybe more, and... he begged me to kill him Tsunade." Kakashi whispered this last part. Tears slid down Tsunade's face as she nodded.

"Go to your other students now Kakashi, I'm sure their dying to here that Naruto's alive, even if his condition is bad." Tsunade stated as she went to the door and slipped inside.

Tsunade breathed in sharply as she took in Naruto's form, leaning against the bedframe with knees to chest, and his head buried into his legs. She quietly noted how Naruto's stomach extended nearly eight inches outward in an unnaturally stiff manner, like a pregnent woman rather than weight, and how Naruto's body shook every few seconds in pain. So the weight hadn't adjusted to the body yet, but that was to be expected.

Tsunade carefully sat on the bed, trying not to cause too much movement, the ride to the hospital on Kakashi's back must have been hell for Naruto's damaged body and she didn't want to increase that pain in any way. Tsunade gently touched one of the arms wrapped loosely around his knees. "Naruto, please look at me." Tsunade commanded softly. Naruto did, tear stained face and trembling lips heartbreaking to see, before shoving his head back into his knees and letting out a pain filled sob. Tsunade, as carefully as she could, moved right next to Naruto and loosely wrapped her arms around him. She whispered comforting words in his ear for several minutes before the boy finally managed to come to some semblance of control. When he did Tsunade silently reached out and healed the boy's ankles and wrists for him. Then she looked up from her work and spoke softly.

"I need you to put your legs down sweety, so I can fix some of the damage, and hopefully that will releave some of the pain. Okay?" Tsunade asked quietly. Naruto nodded slowly, twinging in pain as he moved his legs away from himself, and let them lay sprawled out before him. With the stretched skin it would be painful for Naruto to make any movements for the next week. Tsunade concentrated chakra into her hands, creating the medical chakra, and then gently placed her hand on Naruto's large stone like stomach. She took her time, going over every organ and fixing any damage she found, before soothing the mucles into a relaxed state. When Naruto softly gave out a sigh of relief she smiled. Most fo the pain was still very much there, but she'd been able to fix a little of it. When she got to the actually stomach she cringed. If it had been damaged any further Naruto surely would be dead.

Using an advanced medical jutsu she coaxed the walls in Naruto's stomach to naturally grow larger, faster. In order to heal naturally Tsunade would actually have to increase Naruto's body size to accomidate all the forced stretching and eating. Tsunade would have to keep Naruto at that weight for a couple weeks and then slowly have the boy lose the weight. It was the only safe way for someone to recover from this type of torture. Tsunade then went to the skin and performed the same precedure. It would take about a day for the body to settle and enlarge to the right proportion.

Tsunade then lifted her hand to Naruto's forehead, the fever was still slightly high, but there was nothing she could do about it. The fever was a reaction to the strain on the boy's body and wouldn't dissapate until the strain was gone. It could be there anywhere from a few days to a week. Tsuande sighed. She really didn't want to do this to him but she needed to know in order to come to a better understanding of just what had been done.

"Naruto, you took your physical about six months ago right? Its required for a genin to get it done at least once a year." Tsunade asked quietly. Naruto nodded slowly.

"Well, that's what I have to do now." Tsunade said quietly. I want to measure your height... and your width as well as your... weight... and compare it to your old results. To see how extensive the strain is. So I need you to first sit in the middle of the bed while I go get the measuring tape." Naruto tensed but nodded.

When Tsunade came back to Naruto sitting int he middle of the bed she quietly began to measure how large around the boy was, silently gapping to herself as the sure bulk that had been added. Naruto refused to look at her or the tape that was touching his bloated stomach. When Tsunade pulled out the scale Naruto visably cringed and turned his head away as the woman placed it on the ground. Naruto slowly lowered himself to the floor, Tsunade hurriedly steadying him with her hands, as he stepped on the scale. It creaked and stopped at a number. 'A hundred and fifty five pounds.' Tsunade thought in shock. Naruto just stared down at the number, his face blank and eyes shining. She quietly measured his height and told him to get some rest. Naruto did as he was told, laying on his side when he got on the bed, before she closed the door Tsunade heard the distinct sound of hiccups as Naruto tried not to cry again.
_______________________________________________________

Kakashi sent out a bird to deliver the message to his two other students and met with them in a small waiting room in the hospital. Sakura came bursting through first, eyes wildly looking around as if Naruto would be there, before she walked up to Kakashi with panic in her eyes.

"Where is he? Is he okay?" Sakura asked.

Sasuke entered the room at a walking pace, but from the way the boy's chest rose and fell it was obvious he'd ran all the way tot he hospital. Kakashi raised his hands in front of him to tell them both to calm down.

"Naruto's in the hospital and he is going to live, but you can't see him for a while." Kakashi answered as gently as he could.

"What?! Why not? What happened?" Sakura asked shakily. Sasuke stood stiffly by the door, the boys entire body tense, and ready to snap at the first person to make the mistake of pissing him off. Kakashi's hands tightened into fists on his lap and his eyes narrowed. Both signs that caused Sasuke adn Sakura to tremble.

"Naruto was kidnapped and tortured by the the traitor anbu who assassinated all those politicians the other day." Kakashi said softly. There really wasn't any way to soften news like that. Sakura fell to her knees, tears flowing down her face, and hand to her mouth in horror. Sasuke merely stared at Kakashi, shocked eyes widening, before he walked further into the room and sat down heavily on the couch.

"Why can't we see Naruto? What did they do to him?" Sakura asked brokenly.

There Kakashi hesitated. Naruto didn't want his teammates to see him like he was right now but the blonde had said nothing against telling them what had been done. Perhaps Naruto had simply been in too much pain or simply assumed Kakashi would know not to tell them, but the man believed that they should know why when he explained that it was Naruto who requested that no one see him.

"Have either of you noticed that Naruto heals faster than others?" Kakashi asked. The both of them nodded.

"Well, it's sort of a special power of his, a keiki genki if you will, Naruto can heal from small scratches quicker than most and if he recieves a dangerous or fatal wound it heals instantly." Kakashi quietly explained. They stared at him in awe for a minute, before the man continued. "Unfortunately the enemy knew about this healing power so they... had to resort to other means of torture." Sasuke and Sakura both paled. Sakura reached out her hand and gripped Sasuke's in hers, Sasuke in turn squeezed it, both too stunned and scared to notice what they'd done. "Naruto was... Naruto was force fed... to the point he nearly died." Kakashi finished quietly.
11121111.title: Sasuke and Sakura are told what happened but do...

choices: Sasuke and Sakura get Naruto to eat
Sasuke and Sakura don't get Naruto to eat
111211111.content:
Sasuke and Sakura gapped at Kakashi in shock.

"Wha... what do you mean force fed?" Sakura asked shakily. Sasuke just stayed quiet listening intently. Kakashi tried not to show the shudder that ran through him. They were young, unable to really understand the horror that came with such a torture, they didn't get how bad it really was. God, he really didn't want to explain, but they needed to know how much pain Naruto was in.

"I mean," Kakashi began softly, "that he was chained down and had food shoved down his throat where he had to either swallow or choke. I mean that substance was forced into his stomach to the point that it was forcefully enlarged and that his insides were badly damaged. I mean Naruto's skin was stretched and tissue torn. I mean they tortured Naruto from the inside rather than the outside every single day for the past ten days Sakura. He was in so much pain that he begged them to kill him." Kakashi whispered sternly. Sakura shook her head, mouth opening and closing in silent, horrible comprehension. Sasuke looked like he was going to be sick.

"So... what's his condition right now?" Sasuke asked quietly. Kakashi shook his head, much like how he'd reacted to Tsunade's same question.

"I won't lie, he's in a tremendous amount of pain right now, every move he makes causes him agony. It will be a couple months before he fully recovers." Kakashi explained.

"When can we see him?" Sakura asked. Kakashi fidgeted. This was the hard part.

"You won't be seeing Naruto for a while. Probably not until he's almost fully recovered." Kakashi answered softly. Sakura shot up from her seat. Sasuke looked angry.

"What?!" Sakura yelled out. "Why not?!" Kakashi looked at the ground.

"Naruto... doesn't want anyone to see him... to see what they did." Kakashi told them. This time it was Sasuke who stood up.

"Thats just too bad. We want to see Naruto whether he likes it or not. I don't care how... I don't care how much they made him... I don't care if he's gained weight! Why would we care if he's gained weight?!" Sasuke asked/demanded. "It's not his fault and we want to help him! He's are team mate!" Sasuke said. Sakura nodded her head in agreement.

"Try to look at it from Naruto's perspective, would either of you two want to be seen? Just give Naruto some time. I'm sure in a few days he'll change his mind, but right now Naruto really can't handle seeing you, and for god sake don't tell anyone." Kakashi added sternly. The two nodded solemly.

"Ka... Kakashit sensei?" Sakura asked timidly, almost fearfully. Kakashi nodded for the girl to ask whatever was on her mind. He was pretty sure he knew what it was anyways. "How... how much did they... you know... how much did he gain?" Sakura whispered. Sasuke too looked uncertainly at their sensei. Kakashi frowned visibly.

"Naruto's... Naruto's about a hundred and fifty pounds now." Kakashi said bluntly. Their eyes widened in shock.
________________________________________

Two days had passed since Naruto was brought in. Tsunade gently placed her hand on Narutos large stomach, the large amount of food had finally adjusted somewhat to Naruto so the round belly moved slightly under her hand, now much softer than the tight stone like thing Naruto had been brought in with. She had weighed him this morning and found that with the food naturally absorbed Naruto weighed a whopping hundred and sixty-seven pounds despite the fact that Naruto had eaten nothing in the last two days. While Naruto's belly was still grotesquely large on the short boy it was now soft and natural, much of the forced weight had adjusted itself in other places such as his theighs, waist, chest and arms... and his ass much to Naruto's chagrin. The pain was far less than it had been and Naruto was at least able to stand without assitence. It would still be several days before the blonde could move though. Too many internal wounds still needed to heal before he could do that.

Tsunade moved the plate of food she'd been trying to get Naruto to eat for the last hour or so to the side table and sighed. It was understandable that Naruto wouldn't want anything to do with food at the moment but starving himself would only cause a great deal of damage on his system. An intense amount of gain followed by an intense amount of loss would cause an enormous strain on the boy's body. she tried explaining this to him but the boy refused to listen.

Tenten, behind the divider that seperated her "room" from the latter space of the apartment, reached into the closet and pulled out her spare futon. She hummed quietly as she set up Ryu's sleeping arrangements, smiling slightly as she did so. Tenten still couldn't get over the fact that she had a roomate, it was just so exciting! Still, concerns over the foreign boy inadvertantly fattening her up barraged her. Only after spending some time with her new friend did her concerns ease up a bit. 'Ryu's a good guy, I'm sure that won't happen.'

After putting a blanket over her donated futon, Tenten slid back the divider, "Okay Ryu, all set! What do you say we-" she paused midsentence, Ryu had already slapped together another kitchen appliance, this time a stove top, made from objects around her room! "Oh- Tenten-chan!" the plump ninja said innocently, "Sakura-chan had some questions regarding my recipes, would you like a demonstation as well?"

"R-Ryu..." Tenten giggled awkwardly, "I have a stove, you don't have to keep making these grills..." Sakura, who had only seen a glimpse at the cookbook's contents before the construction of Ryu's oventop, felt the need to delegate just a little further, "All I asked about were the spices..." Ryu blushed lightly, "O-Oh, sorry." he chuckled nervously, "Tenten-chan, may I use your stove then?"

"Yeah, sure." Tenten giggled as he started to dismantle his grill. "Oh no, you go prepare for Sakura's lesson, I'll take care of... this." she caught glimpse of an alarm clock, already begining to melt from the heat, "Next time, you don't even have to ask."

Ryu bowed slightly as he made his way over to the small corner of the room that was the kitchen, Tenten sitting down to take care of Ryu's franken-stove. "Wow, he really is into cooking." Sakura whispered as she sat down beside the weapon-nin, "He's amazing- I can't wait to taste some of his food!" Tenten laughed lightly, "Yeah, I just wished he were a little more observant, my stack of magazines wasn't quite intended to be kindling."

Soon enough, the stove was dismembered and all of it's components returned to their rightful places around Tenten's apartment. And while the two leaf ninjas worked in their own corner, Ryu set up everything he could possibly need for Sakura's lesson from the confines of his own bag "Sakura-chan, are you ready?" he beckoned her from the kitchen, "I'll teach you how to make chicken and fried rice!"

"Sounds great, let's start right away!" Sakura practically shot off of the couch to meet with the pudgy ninja chef in the kitchen. Ryu smiled, "I'm so happy you're interested in cooking with me, Sakura-chan." he picked up his baggie of uncooked rice, "I'm sure you'll be a wonderful assistant, would you start by boiling some water?"

Tenten stretched her arms as she leaned back into her couch, "I'll leave you to it Ryu, I've got some tr-" but she was interrupted by the chef, too enthralled in his art to fully listen, "Oh don't worry Tenten-chan, I saw it, I'll be sure to sprinkle some on your meal."

"M-My meal?" Tenten eyed her stomach, still taut from her earlier meals with Shizune. Surely one little indulgence wouldn't be the end of her rock-hard figure, would it?
123121111.title: They finally make it to Tenten's house...

1231211111.content:
"Of course!" beamed Ryu with a smile as he received the boiling water from his eager assistant as pour it into his pot. "You're doing so much for me by letting me take shelter here and even protecting me. Cooking for you is the least I can do!." answered the chef as he stirred the water and added a few spices to the mix. "Sakura would you mind bringing me some flour?"

"Of course!" replied the energetic girl as she searched the pantry for the required ingredient. After hearing about Ryu's intended hospitality, Tenten felt herself grow a bit pale. Surely he doesn't cook highly delicious meals all the time right? Feeling a bit of doubt with her reasoning, the bun-haired girl made her way to her kitchen, which had transformed into Ryu's workplace in a matter of minutes. Sakura had returned with the flour and happily watched the method in which Ryu used the flour to make long stringy noodles. Sakura noted that his technique was virtually flawless and watched him mix them in with the broth he had created shortly before. She just couldn't believe how perfectly he was creating such a simple meal! Tenten watched his little performance as well, and her uneasy feeling in the bit of her stomach grew by just that much. She figured if it was prepared that well, it must have an incredible taste, just like her previous meal concocted by the young ninja chef. Feeling like she should clarify a few things with her guest, she walked over to the busy young man and placed a firm hand on his rounded shoulder.

"Hey Ryu, you don't need to..." began the weapon-oriented girl, but was soon interrupted by Ryu shoving a spoonful of his homemade broth into the unsuspecting girl's mouth. Once again, Tenten felt that same sensation come over her body and gave out a little moan of pleasure. 'How did it taste Tenten-chan? Honestly I think I can give the flavor a more distinct taste." said Ryu as he slowly began to drift into his own little world of cooking ideas. Tenten stayed in place for a bit, until she decided it would be best trying to talk to him later. Dealing with Ryu in his 'cooking-mode' might cause more damage to her normal body-fat levels. She sighed and made her way once again to the living room to wait for the meal to become completed. Ryu then moved on to his next station and began to work on cooking the rice. "Sakura-chan do you mind getting some beef and soy sauce?" asked Ryu to his assistant as he stirred the rice in his saucer. When he failed to hear a response from his young assistant, he looked over to where he saw her last. The pink-haired girl was currently at his previous station and looked at the pot of broth curiously. She reached for the spoon and tasted the peculiar type of soup. As soon as the warm liquid traversed down her throat, he green eyes lit up in delight!

"Ryu-kun, this is incredible! It's just so wonderful!" gushed the young woman as she swallowed another mouthful of the soup. Ryu went over to her and gently took the eating utensil away from his assistant. "Now, now Sakura-chan. I don't want you to ruin your appetite. Now would you mind giving me some beef and soy sauce?" asked the chef as he once again headed towards his rice. He noticed that this was usual behavior for anyone who would help him out with his cooking.

"Ah, sorry Ryu-kun, I couldn't help myself. I'll get them right away." replied the slightly dazed girl as she went to the fridge. She promptly gathered the required materials and placed them near Ryu's cooking station. "Here you go Ryu-kun." said the assistant as she peaked over to what he was cooking now.

"Thank you Sakura-chan. There's only a little bit for me to finish so why don't you wait with Tenten-chan?" said Ryu as he cooked the meat. Sakura nodded her head and went over to where her bun-haired girl was waiting. She plopped her rear onto the couch and felt herself growing impatient. 'That soup was amazing. Who knew a simple ramen meal could be so incredible?!' thought the pink-haired nin to herself. She looked over to her friend and saw that she looked to be in deep thought.

"Tenten-chan, are you alright?" asked Sakura with a bit of concern. Maybe she was upset that her kitchen was in such a mess? "Are you mad about how messy Ryu-kun and I made your kitchen? I swear, me and him will make it spotless before you know it!" reassured the worrying friend.


"What? No that's fine. I was just thinking of how it's gonna be with Ryu-kun living with me for the rest of this month." stated Tenten as she looked over to the kitchen, the uneasy feeling growing within herself.

"If you'd like I can stay with you guys too."

"What?" replied the girl with a bit of a shocked tone.

"I know that Ryu-kun might be a handful due to how excited he gets about cooking. I think I could help out by assisting him and also stopping him from completely destroying your kitchen." said the girl with a bit of a laugh envisioning a chibi-Ryu blowing up Tenten's house. Sakura also saw this as an opportunity to learn as much from the chef before he had to depart her village. 'Helping out Tenten and picking up new cooking skills, two birds one stone!' thought the girl as she grew excited of this chance. Tenten, however, saw this as the perfect solution to her 'little' problem. 'With her helping out Ryu in the kitchen, she'll keep him occupied and I can train of these extra calories! But I wonder if she know just what exactly she's getting into.'

"Well, alright Sakura-chan. I have a spare futon, but we'll need to share rooms. Is that fine?"

"Yup. I have no problem with that Tenten-chan." replied Sakura with a smile directed towards her kind (but scheming) friend.

'This is going to be perfect.' both girls thought as they thought over their respected plans. Though these thoughts were soon interrupted by the chef-nin calling out to them.

"Girls! Dinner is ready!" announced Ryu as he finished setting the table for his two female friends. Both ninjas became excited and hurried over to the table. Ryu had set quite a spread for the three of them. The main dish was his ramen, with beef-fried rice and an assortment of simpler meats. Both Tenten and Sakura felt themselves nearly drooling by the sight of the feast itself. "Well, dig in!" said the boy as he began to fill his bowl and plate. The girls followed suit and fill their own plates. As soon as Tenten slurped the first of her ramen noodles, the feeling of complete happiness and joy flowed into her very being.

\Two hours later//

"Uurp, no more please..." moaned Sakura as she nestled her bloated belly in the aftermath of her gorging herself. Her belly felt so heavy and was stiff to the touch. Even the slightest of movements caused some discomfort to her overstuffed stomach. Tenten fared no better than her companion. Her own stomach, which was still recovering from her earlier meal, felt to her like it doubled in size. It puffed out a bit from her waistline like previously, but there was one key difference with this occurrence. When she rubbed her belly this time, the girl became a little frantic when she felt that her former rock-hard abdomen has become a little soft. Although, it was still hardened by the meal, the girl could definitely pinch a bit of her new belly-fat. She simply sighed and leaned further back into her chair, attempting to soothe her pains.

"Well, it looks like you enjoyed your meals! I'll be going to bed now. I have already cleaned the kitchen while you two where on your fifth helpings. Once again thank you for your hospitality and I can't wait to make you breakfast in the morning!" said the visiting chef as he left the room. Tenten wished him good night and then looked over to her equally stuffed friend. Sakura stood up with a bit of difficulty and walked over to the exit of Tenten's apartment

"I-I'm going to *burp* get a few of my things from my home. I'll be back later kay Tenten-chan?" stated Sakura while still gently rubbing her formerly flat stomach. Tenten nodded as she slowly got up as well to say goodbye. After she left, the brown-haired girl looked over to how messy the table the table still was. She sighed and patted her belly, still feeling that soft bit of belly brushing up against her lean fingers.

'I hope Sakura's gonna be okay being left alone with him...'

12312111112.content:
It was a rainy day in the Hidden Leaf Village, the droplets were hardly light and hit anything unfortunate enough to be underneath them with heavy thuds. The rain was so bad, in fact, that most shops around the village gave up on getting any customers and closed up! But, of course, no one told Tenten until it was too late. She had just arrived at the training grounds before the heavy downpour interrupted her desperate attempts to work off some extra calories.

"Ohh..." she whimpered, still getting soaked underneath a nearby tree, "I hate rain..." Normally the weather wouldn't have been such a big deal regarding her training regime, but since Neji was stuck at home and the twin pair of eyebrows were out on a mission, there was no one for Tenten to practice with! "Stupid Lee, at least he could have stuck around to help me with training, the one time I actually kinda want him around, too!"

An ominous clap of thunder made the bunhaired girl jump slightly, "M-Maybe I should just go home, I can always train later..." somehow, going home didn't seem too terrible when it felt like someone was pouring a bucket of water over her head...

...The apartment door opened suddenly, a soaking wet Tenten stood in the doorway with a mildly disgruntled look on her face. "Tenten-chan!" Sakura greeted her temporary roomie from the couch, "You're home- wow you're wet." the weapon specialist sneezed accordingly, "I think I might have caught a cold out there..."

"Didn't you read the paper today?" Ryu asked, genuinely concerned for his friend, "It called for heavy rain and high winds!" Tenten smiled awkwardly, "N-No, I guess I forgot, ehehe..." She really didn't read the paper, but figured that her determination would guide her through whatever forces Mother Nature could throw at her. She was, however, wrong.

"Well, at any rate, did you get some training done?" Sakura asked, flipping off the small television across the sofa. Tenten's awkward demeanor only deepened, starting to chuckle nervously, "Oh yeah, haha, I got lots of training done, Sakura-chan, lots!" Ryu smiled from his seated position at the table, picking up a bowl of soup from the low surface, "That's wonderful, here, I made some soba."

Tenten's gaze travelled to Sakura, only now noticing the stuffed belly that the pink haired medical ninja sported. "Uh..." she mumbled, torn between her desire to please her friend and anxiety regarding his cooking, "I-uh... I... thanks, Ryu, a bowl of hot soba sounds great." she sat down next to the bulky foreigner, "Just one though okay?" Sakura heaved herself up, "I guess I'll have another one, then." she chimed as she made her way across the apartment to make herself another bowl, "Wouldn't want Ryu-kun's delicious noodles to go to waste!"

Ryu stared intently at Tenten, "Are you sure, Tenten-chan?" he was somewhat shocked that someone had turned down a hot meal after getting drenched in a manner such as Tenten, "Hot soups are good for colds, after all, my Papa's recipe warms up the body really quickly." Sakura sat down with a satisfied groan, "Come on Tenten-chan, you better eat it before I do!" she jeered at her bunhaired friend.

Tenten smiled, thoroughly defeated by Ryu's excellent cooking and her own weak stomach, "Alright, Ryu-kun, maybe two- but only because I don't want Sakura to be the only one to get any!" she teased the bloated pinkette right back, "Hey, watch it!" she feigned snarkiness

Ryu smiled warmly, it was so nice to have friends...

123121111121.content:
The dreary rain from the day past had settles down as a new morning dawned. Tenten slowly awoke as bits of sunshine hit her sleeping face. The currently 'bunless' girl sat up and gave a rather large yawn. Wiping a few strands of her brown hair from her face, the girl looked over to the area where her pink-haired friend slept and noticed that she was gone.

"Probably went to go help Ryu-kun make breakfast again.' concluded the slightly drowsy girl as she absentmindingly used her small hand to rub her pj covered stomach. She sighed as the girl felt a little more of the softness under the touch of her still-lithe fingers. 'I wonder what he'll make this time. I actually have a craving for some waffles.' began to think the girl as she felt a small rumble come from her midsection. The day before he had made stacks and stacks of fresh pancakes for the three to eat, complete with whipped cream and strawberry syrup. Needless to say, both girl devoured them easily. Deciding to leave her hair down, she made her way towards her kitchen. The young girl could hear various sound eminating from the hallway and could only assume that her kitchen was once again in a state of disarray. Though that small complaint disappeared as the scent of the fattening breakfast slowly wafted into her sense of smell. Tenten entered te kitchen to see Ryu busy using her stove to create some waffles. Tenten silently cheered to herself as her small breakfast wish had came true. The brown-haired girl slowly made her way to the table where her pink haired friend was scarffing down the fried food. Tenten could already the swell on Sakura's increasing abdomen. She noted that Sakura was still in her sleeping garments as well. A plain t-shirt and short-shorts adorned her slowly-growing figure. Though she could exactly tell what it was, Tenten felt as if Sakura looked like there was a little bit more to her than usual.

"Good morning Sakura-chan. How'd ya sleep?" asked Tenten as she recieved a plate full of the delicious waffles from Ryu. "Good morning to you too Ryu-kun. Thank you for the food." said the girl as she began the hearty breakfast. Sakura had yet to reply to her greeting as Ryu placed even more waffles in front of
the girl to stuff her maw with. Like before the medic opted to drown her breakfast with Ryu's homeade syrup. The chef smiled as he watched his two friends enjoy his cuisine.

"Good morning to yourself Tenten-chan. Hey, I was wondering if you and Sakura-chan would take me on a tour of the village? The weather is beautiful and the paper said to expect great weather all day!"

"Sure Ryu-kun. We'll get ready after breakfast." replied Tenten between sweet mouthfulls of the fried dough. Sakura, who was sitting at the opposite end of the table as the long-haired girl, finally finished her third helping and leaned back into the slightly creaking chair. Bit of syrup remained on her softer face and parts of her shirt. Like all the past meals involving Ryu's meal, the girl found herself absoultly stuffed. Tenten simply ate another mouthful waiting for her friend to finally notice her presense.

"Oh good morning Tenten-chan! I didn't see you come in."

\. Two hours later, on the streets of Konoha//

"Well Ryu, that complete's the downtown section of Konoha. Where do you want to go next?" asked the brown-haired girl with a few sticks of dango in her hands. Like before, it seemed like Ryu himself had an insatiable appetite and the trio kept stopping at random food stands. Both Sakura and Ryu were happy to taste so many foods and the chef would always inform his current assistant the exact ingredients and method to create each snack. The medic-nin would give him a look of awe with each perfect lecture and mentally took note of everything he said.

"Well, it's getting close to lunch-time, so I was wondering if we can take a small break. Besides, you two must be famished from all of this walking!" answered Ryu as he finished his last stick of dango.

'But we've been eating this entire time....' thought the girl as she gave the boy a slightly weird face.

"I agree with Ryu-kun, I'm starving!" said Sakura as she pointed to her growling belly.

"Fine, fine. Do you have anywhere in mind Ryu-kun?"

"Well I saw a very interesting restaurant back in the downtown district. Do you mind if we go and check that out?" asked Ryu as he brought his hand towards his round chin, trying to think of the restaurant in mind.

"Oh, I think I know which one he's talking about. I'm pretty sure it recently opened too." excitingly answered Sakura as the image of said restaurant flashed into her head.

"Right, lead the way then Sakura-chan." replied the older girl, less than happy at the thought of eating for the 6th time that day. Right before they were about to head out, a voice suddenly called out to the two girls.

"Hey Sakura, Tenten!" exclaimed a certain dirty-blond suna-nin as she walked over to the small group. Dressed in her traditional black battle kimono, she still wore her hair into the peculiar four ponytails.

"Eh? Temari-san?" asked Tenten, clearly confused at seeing the female shinobi in her village. Suna was usually quite far from the village and the girl only visited for official reasons and those were a little rare. Though the weapons-mistress had to admit that she wasn't exactly happy to see the jounin. It seemed like she still held a grudge for the woman defeating her so easily in the chuunin exams long ago.

"Long time no see you two. Who's the kid?" curtly said the woman as she pointed her finger towards the hefty young man.

"Ah, Temari-san. This is our new friend Ryu-kun. We've been showing him around as he's just visiting the village for a month. What brings you to Konoha?" said the medic. Unlike her female companion, she enjoyed te company of the older woman. They shared quite a past with each other after all!

"I've been helping out with relations and other offical mumbo jumbo. But I haven't had anything to do in a few days and I've been bored out of my mind and I can't leave for like another two weeks. Mind if I tag along with you three a bit.

"Off course! The more the merrier!" replied Sakura as she motioned everyone to follow her to the restaurant of Ryu's choice. Tenten slightly grimmaced at these turns of events. First she would be subjected to even more calorie-high meals and then she had to deal with the very person to humiliate her ninja-skills. Her sad thoughts were soon over-shadowed by Sakura's conversation with the pig-tailed girl.

"Hey Temari-san. Did you know that Ryu-kun here is a master chef-ninja!? You should come back to our place later to try some of his cooking. It's really impresive..."

1231211111211.content:
"There ya go kids." a gruff, elderly man seated the party of four, "Here're your menus, and I hope you enjoy your meal." Tenten reciprocated his smile, "Thank you, I'm sure we will."

Ryu and Sakura seemed pretty excited about coming to Tama-Go's BBQ House, of course Ryu was always excited when it came to anything revolving around the culinary arts. Temari decided to come along, not that Tenten was too enthralled at sharing a meal with her, and insisted that the "new guy" treats. Which Ryu, friendly as he was, agreed to.

Not that the meal would be too terribly expensive, Tama-Go's was a relatively modest hut. They couldn't even afford grills at each seating arrangement like their competing barbecue hut, leaving all the cooking to one chef in the back. "Poor guy..." Tenten looked at him, visible through the archway, "He's sure got a lot of people to cook for, I hope he doesn't crack."

"So, Ryu, what do you think looks good?" Sakura asked her friend, leaning over from her seated position to point at the menu, "I think the Teriyaki Beef sounds good right about now." he responded, "Of course, if you want I could always-"

"No!" Tenten swiftly jumped over and stopped Ryu from grabbing anything he could use to make another one of his jerryrigged contraptions, "I-I mean, we're here so you don't have to cook, so you can enjoy someone else's cooking for a change." she released his soft arm slowly after startling him so badly, "Really, Ryu, you don't have to cook for us all the time, sometimes we should get to treat you to a meal."

The plump boy choked slightly, smiling wamly at his bunhaired companion, "Oh... th-thank you, Tenten-chan, I'll be sure to enjoy this meal then!" Sakura nudged one of his lovehandles, "Yeah, come on, you order the beef and whatever else you want, this one's on me." the pinkette gave him a thumbs up, "consider the occassional meal a thank you for teaching me how to cook!" Ryu felt something well up inside his throat

"Oh geez..." Temari, seated beside Tenten, "Now you've gone and made him well up." Tenten nudged her, "Be nice, Temari-san." Ryu turned back to the two women seated across from him, "Th-Thank you for offering, Sakura-chan, but Temari-san said that I should-" Sakura laughed nervously, "Nevermind what Temari says, it's on me... right Temari?"

Temari laughed, "It was just a joke!"

Their conversation was cut short by the second arrival of the burly waiter, this time carrying a notepad. "Okay, you kids ready to order?" his smile still warm despite hiding behind his bushy gray beard. Ryu started, "Yes, I'll have the..."

Four hours later, things would be quite different.

After recieving his beef all-but-quickly, Ryu had to point out that not only was it undercooked; but that it was small, relatively tasteless, and was drenched in the wrong sauce. He went on to say that Sakura's chicken was flat and looked very much like a frozen patty thawed out with the outer layer peeled off, Temari's was the only barbecue meal ordered yet it was only topped with the according sauce, not marinated and cooked in it. Even Tenten's salad caught the chef-nin's attention, being mostly lettuce with very little variation in vegetables. All of this, however polite it sounded coming out of Ryu's mouth, managed to infuriate the chef.

This led to a series of events (along with yet another grill) that placed Ryu in the modest kitchen. Without a doubt, every customer was delighted with tonight's staff reassignment. Even with such poor quality ingredients, Ryu managed to make splendid meals that filled up everyone's bellies. His friends were no exception, they all recieved much more generous, highly addicting, portions than asked for; Sakura and Tenten had grown quite used to this treatment by now.

"No... More..." Tenten grunted, pushing her plate away from her. She simply couldn't eat any more! It was baffling how Ryu could get such wonderful flavor out of such terrible provisions. Sakura found herself torn between unbuttoning her trousers and finishing off the very last bite of chicken, groaning slightly from the intense pain in her middle. Temari had reached her maximum too, finding little to no more joy in eating ever again... at least for now. "Is he - Is he always like this?" Temari asked, leaning back on her hands to support her overworked middle. "Kinda..." Sakura grunted

Ryu and his party were shortly kicked out after that point; the formerly friendly waiter realizing that while Ryu's food was good, it kept people ordering until there was nothing left in their already reserved stock!

And even though he was banned from Tama-Go's BBQ House for life, Ryu still managed to go to bed smiling that night, remarking on how wonderful it was to have friends like his...

12312111112111.content:
Tenten stood in front of the Hokage, squinching every part of her body in a futile attempt to hide the small weight gain she had accumulated over the short duration of Ryu's trip. In only a week since taking in the chef-nin, Tenten had found that her clothes were fitting rather snugly, and her trousers practically had to be forced to button. The bun haired girl held her hands behind her back, trying to press any weight around her top half into itself, in theory making her appear smaller.

"S-So, Tsunade-sama..." she stuttered, finding it hard to keep a straight face when she was just so embarrased, "You wanted to s-see me?"

The bloated blonde behind the desk leaned back in her chair laxly, "It's nothing much, I just wanted to know how Ryu was acclimating to his new lifestyle." she, of course, hadn't lost any weight by sitting on her bum all day (not) doing paperwork, "Is he adjusting as well as hoped?"

"Oh yeah, he's adjusting just fine..." she trailed off as she mentally played back all of their misadventures throughout the week. Cooking was only one of Ryu's talents, people really seemed to like him; enough so that the local chefs had started calling him by name. Sakura practically worshiped him, albeit mostly for his culinary prowess, and even the generally antisocial Temari had gradually warmed up to the pudgy boy. And Tenten herself found him quite pleasant to be around, he was always friendly and very considerate. If only he didn't cook so much...

"So he's getting along with everyone?" the husky Hokage asked plainly, "When he stayed with me, all he ever did was stay in the kitchen."

"That's because you had him cook so much for you, Tsunade-sama..." Shizune, the heaviest porker in the room had to speak up, Tonton giving a compliant "Oink..."

"Oh no, he's actually quite the people person." Tenten delegated, "Every few days we go out for a walk around the town with Sakura-chan and he's always voulenteering down at the Shibusin or the Dumpling Shop." she remembered the containers that Ryu had asked her to deliver, "Oh- that reminds me, he sent each of you something." the weapon-nin smiled as she picked up two small boxes, "He knew that I'd be coming to see you today and-"

"Are those pork dumplings?!" Shizune's mouth started to water instantly (Tonton put off slightly with the mention of pig product) The older woman set her pig down lightly on the floor and hastilly grabbed the box, "Ryu-kun's the best!" she took a heavy whiff of the aroma flooding from the package, "They are, yes!" she pumped her soft arm and greedily unwrapped her parcel.

Tsunade got curious and sniffed her own box, surely enough, it too was pork dumplings. "Mmm, delicious!" she moaned, simply by using her expertly trained nose she could tell that they were as delectable as ever. Tenten watched her entire body quiver as she recklessly tore open the package. Tenten sweatdropped at the sight of the tubby women tearing open packages like children with new toys. Not that she could blame them for being excited, she and Sakura had plenty of a good time stuffing themselves with the initial batch of dumplings last night before bed.

Even so, Tenten found own mouth wet at just the sight of Ryu's marvelous cooking even moreso than usual. "O-kay, so I guess I'll leave you two alone then." Tenten leaves the room quickly before she found herself at the opposite end of one of Tsunade's pork buns (and thereby her fists) The weapon specialist slammed the door shut, sliding down until she was sitting solidly against the floor... noting just how much softer it felt to sit lately.

Reluctantly, Tenten released the heavy breath of air she sucked in to keep from looking like a total hog in front of her Hokage. She sighed, happy to be rid of the heavy burden... until her button snapped off of her ninja trousers. "Crap..." she whined
